title: Ratio
paragraphs: Comparison of two of two quantities of the same kind will result in a ratio.
The ratio of a number 'a' to another number 'b'  $@(b \neq 0)@$ is the quotient  $@\frac{a}{b}@$ and is written as $@a:b@$ where 'a' and 'b' are called its terms.
If should the two be quantities are in same the same unit(kind) they should be converted into the same unit.
Ratio of Boys to girls is 7 : 9
Ratio of Girls to boys is 9 : 7

title: Proportion
paragraphs: When two ratios are equal they are said to be in proportion.
So, Product of means = Product of extremes in a proportion.
K is called the mean proportional between 4 and 16.

title: Percentage and its Applications
paragraphs: Percentage : A fraction with its denominator as 100 is called a percent.

title: Cost Price and Selling Price
paragraphs: The money paid by the shopkeeper to buy the goods is called the Cost price (C.P.) and
the price at which the goods are sold is called the Selling Price (S.P.).

title: Marked Price
paragraphs: The price that is mentioned on a commodity is called the Marked Price.

title: Profit and Loss
paragraphs: If S.P > C.P., Profit = S.P. - C.P.
If S.P < C.P. Loss = C.P. - S.P.

title: Simple Interest
paragraphs: Simple Interest S.I = $@\frac{PTR}{100}@$ Where P = Principal, T = Time, R = Rate of interest.

title: Discount
paragraphs: Discount is offered on the Marked Price (M.P.) of the article by the shopkeeper and is generally expressed as a percentage of the M.P.

title: Direct and Inverse Variation
paragraphs: Direct Proportion : When x increases, y increases, when x decreases y decreases

title: Inverse Proportion
paragraphs: When x increases, y decreases ; When x decreases y increases.

title: Speed, Distance and Time
paragraphs: To convert km/hr to m/sec multiply by  $@\frac{5}{18}@$
To convert m/sec to km/hr multiply by  $@\frac{18}{5}@$
